  "title": "Head of Procurement",
  "description": "Power Control &amp; Appliances Ltd. (PCA) has been a pioneer in Power Transmission, Distribution, and Rural Electrification in Nigeria &ndash; Africa. Having Mastered the EPC (Engineering, Procurement &amp; Construction) field, PCA has grown from strength to strength over three decades.

PCA started breaking ground with huge capital investments in the Power and Infrastructure sector, which then led to the successful commissioning of turnkey projects in Power Transmission &amp; Distribution, Generation, Rural Electrification, Solar Mini Grids, and Operations and Maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Procurement

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Head of Procurement is responsible for developing and executing procurement strategies to ensure cost-effective, timely, and compliant acquisition of industrial components and services required for power projects and operations.
	The role requires strong knowledge of the Lagos retail market, import/export regulations, procurement SOPs, and logistics handling, including ports and customs processes.


Key Responsibilities

Procurement Strategy &amp; Operations:


	Develop, implement, and manage procurement policies, systems, and procedures in line with company objectives.
	Identify reliable vendors, suppliers, and contractors within the Lagos retail and wholesale industrial market.
	Negotiate supplier contracts to achieve the best value in terms of price, quality, and delivery.


Vendor &amp; Market Management:


	Source and evaluate vendors for industrial components, electrical materials, and equipment.
	Build and maintain strong supplier relationships while ensuring compliance with ethical standards.
	Monitor and analyze Lagos retail market trends for industrial components and recommend purchasing decisions accordingly.


Import/Export &amp; Logistics:


	Handle export formalities, customs clearance, and HSN code documentation.
	Manage port handling operations, ensuring smooth clearance of goods and coordination with freight forwarders, shipping lines, and customs agents.
	Oversee transportation, warehousing, and last-mile delivery of procured items.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure procurement practices comply with company SOPs, statutory laws, and international trade regulations.
	Mitigate risks in supplier contracts, logistics, and customs processes.
	Maintain proper documentation for audits, regulatory inspections, and internal control.


Team Leadership &amp; Reporting:


	Lead, train, and mentor procurement and logistics staff.
	Collaborate with engineering, finance, and operations teams to align procurement with project requirements.
	Prepare periodic procurement reports, spend analysis, and supplier performance evaluations.


Key Requirements


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Business Administration, Engineering, or related field. A professional certification (CIPS, ISM, etc.) is an added advantage.
	Experience: Minimum of 8&ndash;12 years in procurement and logistics, with at least 5 years in a leadership role within the power, engineering, or manufacturing sector.
	Strong knowledge of Lagos retail/industrial market.
	Experience with export formalities, HSN codes, and procurement SOPs.
	Proven expertise in port handling, shipping, and logistics management.
	Excellent negotiation, vendor management, and analytical skills.
	Strong leadership and communication abilities.


Salary
N250,000 - N500,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;pcarecruitment79@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

	Oversee transportation, warehousing, and last-mile delivery of procured items.

Job Description
Strategy and Policy Development:


	Develop and implement HR strategies that align with the company&rsquo;s objectives.
	Work with the HR team in developing and recommending improvements to SOPs, HR Guidelines, Processes, Policies, and Frameworks. These should comply with employment regulations improve business processes, and or working relations, and drive performance.
	Ensure the Employee handbook is up to date, and outlines company operations in a manner that is easy to assimilate, understand, and comprehend.
	Advise the management team on all employee and employment-related matters (Compensation, disciplinary, Terms and conditions of engagement, Change management, Contract Compliance, best practices), and represent employee perspective in decision-making processes at management and or senior management levels.
	Implement HR policies and ensure compliance with national employment laws/regulations, and HR best practices.


Recruitment &amp; Onboarding:


	Understand hiring trends in the Health Industry and develop an internal system to monitor and manage the organization&rsquo;s vacancies.
	Support in the recruitment process, from drafting/ reviewing job descriptions, advert placements, interviewing and selection, issuing Engagement Contracts, Reference verification, etc.
	Work with the team in continually improving the recruitment process, ensuring job design and specifications are updated, recruitment panelists are defined and interview questions pool are standardized for each job role.
	Coordinate the Onboarding process for new hires and design a robust and systemic onboarding system reflective of the company culture. This should include orientation programs &amp; resources, training, policy dissemination, and all that is needed to help employees transition into their roles.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Deputy Human Resource Manager
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Description
Strategy and Policy Development:
     

            
    




	Develop and implement HR strategies that align with the company’s objectives.
	Work with the HR team in developing and recommending improvements to SOPs, HR Guidelines, Processes, Policies, and Frameworks. These should comply with employment regulations improve business processes, and or working relations, and drive performance.
	Ensure the Employee handbook is up to date, and outlines company operations in a manner that is easy to assimilate, understand, and comprehend.
	Advise the management team on all employee and employment-related matters (Compensation, disciplinary, Terms and conditions of engagement, Change management, Contract Compliance, best practices), and represent employee perspective in decision-making processes at management and or senior management levels.
	Implement HR policies and ensure compliance with national employment laws/regulations, and HR best practices.


Recruitment & Onboarding:


	Understand hiring trends in the Health Industry and develop an internal system to monitor and manage the organization’s vacancies.
	Support in the recruitment process, from drafting/ reviewing job descriptions, advert placements, interviewing and selection, issuing Engagement Contracts, Reference verification, etc.
	Work with the team in continually improving the recruitment process, ensuring job design and specifications are updated, recruitment panelists are defined and interview questions pool are standardized for each job role.
	Coordinate the Onboarding process for new hires and design a robust and systemic onboarding system reflective of the company culture. This should include orientation programs & resources, training, policy dissemination, and all that is needed to help employees transition into their roles.
	Effectively manage the exit experience by introducing/maintaining a well-organized and fair off boarding process (Collection of feedback, exit interviews, etc.) that ensures a smooth transition for both the company and the exiting employee.

	Refine the documentation and data management system for Employee Information, Leave Requests, Employee transitions/Promotions/transfers, and other work-related information.

	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
